Michael Feldman.label: Michael Feldman
Michael Feldman.description: Michael Feldman is an American radio personality. He is the host of Michael Feldman's Whad'Ya Know?, a radio program distributed by Public Radio International. His former announcer, Jim Packard, referred to him as "The Sage of Wisconsin." Wikipedia

Suraj Singh Thakuri.label: Suraj Singh Thakuri
Suraj Singh Thakuri.description: Suraj Singh Thakuri is a Nepali presenter, director and producer. He is by far known as the presenter of the longest running Nepali talk show Call Kantipur which airs everyday on Kantipur Television. Wikipedia

Tania Bryer.label: Tania Bryer
Tania Bryer.description:
Tania Bryer is a British television presenter, currently affiliated with global network CNBC.
The series CNBC Meets sees her interview a mix of subjects including UK media magnate Richard Desmond, U.S. ... Wikipedia
Education: Edmund A. Walsh School of Foreign Service

Susan Stamberg.label: Susan Stamberg
Susan Stamberg.description: Susan Stamberg is an American radio journalist who is a Special Correspondent for National Public Radio and guest host for Weekend Edition Saturday. Wikipedia
Susan Stamberg.Born: September 7, 1938 (age 75), Newark, New Jersey, United States

Bob Edwards.label: Bob Edwards
Bob Edwards.description: Robert Alan "Bob" Edwards is a Peabody Award-winning member of the National Radio Hall of Fame. He was the first broadcaster with a large national following to join the field of satellite radio. Wikipedia

Adriana Xenides.label: Adriana Xenides
Adriana Xenides.description: Adriana Xenides was an Australian television personality. Born in Buenos Aires, Argentina to a Greek father and a Spanish mother, she moved to Australia as a child, and became well known for her ... Wikipedia

Woody Durham.label: Woody Durham
Woody Durham.description: Woody Lombardi Durham, known as "The Voice of the Tar Heels", was the longtime play-by-play radio announcer for University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill football and basketball teams from 1971 to 2011. Wikipedia
Woody Durham.Born: August 8, 1941 (age 72), Mebane, North Carolina, United States
Education: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

Carol Hirschfeld.label: Carol Hirschfeld
Carol Hirschfeld.description: Carol Hirschfeld is a New Zealand broadcaster. She is best known for her role as a TV3 News presenter alongside John Campbell from 1998 until 2005. Wikipedia

Gary Mittelholtz.label: Gary Mittelholtz
Gary Mittelholtz.description: Gary Brian Mittelholtz was a Canadian radio journalist, known foremost for his work with CBC Radio in New Brunswick. His radio reporting won him a gold prize at the Atlantic Journalism Awards. Wikipedia

George Atkins (broadcaster).label: George Atkins
George Atkins (broadcaster).description: George Stuart Atkins CM was a Canadian broadcaster, a CBC television and radio host, and the founder of Farm Radio International. Wikipedia

David Kestenbaum.label: David Kestenbaum
David Kestenbaum.description: David Samuel Kestenbaum is an American radio correspondent for National Public Radio. He generally covers science, energy, and economic issues. Wikipedia

Fred Allen.label: Fred Allen
Fred Allen.description: Fred Allen was an American comedian whose absurdist, topically pointed radio show made him one of the most popular and forward-looking humorists in the Golden Age of American radio. Wikipedia
Fred Allen.Died: March 17, 1956, New York City, New York, United States

Michael Baisden.label: Michael Baisden
Michael Baisden.description: Michael Baisden is a radio personality and host of The Michael Baisden Show. The show is syndicated by Cumulus Media and is heard in over 78 media markets nationwide with over 8 million listeners daily. Wikipedia
Education: Chicago Vocational Career Acad High School

Becky Worley.label: Becky Worley
Becky Worley.description: Becky Worley is an American journalist and broadcaster. She is the tech contributor for Good Morning America on ABC, host and blogger for a web show on Yahoo! Tech. Wikipedia

Jason Lewis (radio host).label: Jason Lewis
Jason Lewis (radio host).description: Jason Mark Lewis is an American radio talk show host and political commentator. Wikipedia

Jeremy Schilling.label: Jeremy Schilling
Jeremy Schilling.description: Jeremy Schilling, nickname 'J Schil,' is a Jewish-American radio personality who currently hosts Teeing It Up With Jeremy Schilling. Wikipedia
Jeremy Schilling.Born: July 22, 1988 (age 25), Marlboro, New Jersey, United States

Barbara Frum.label: Barbara Frum
Barbara Frum.description: Barbara Frum, OC was a Canadian radio and television journalist, acclaimed for her interviews for the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation. Wikipedia
Barbara Frum.Born: September 8, 1937, Niagara Falls, New York, United States

Gary Sullivan (radio).label: Gary Sullivan
Gary Sullivan (radio).description: Gary Sullivan is the host of the American nationally syndicated radio program At Home with Gary Sullivan. Wikipedia

Frank Gallop.description: Frank Gallop June 30, 1900, Boston, Massachusetts – May 17, 1988, Palm Beach, Florida was an American radio and television personality. Wikipedia
Frank Gallop.Died: May 5, 1988, New York City, New York, United States

Scott Simon.label: Scott Simon
Scott Simon.description: Scott Simon is an American journalist and the host of Weekend Edition Saturday on National Public Radio. He also guest-hosts Need to Know. Wikipedia

Don Wilson (announcer).label: Don Wilson
Don Wilson (announcer).description: Don Wilson was an American announcer and occasional actor in radio and television, with a Falstaffian vocal presence, remembered best as the rotund announcer and comic foil to the star of The Jack Benny Program. Wikipedia
Don Wilson (announcer).Died: April 25, 1982, Cathedral City, California, United States

Gary Dolphin.label: Gary Dolphin
Gary Dolphin.description: Gary Dolphin is an American sports broadcaster. He is currently the radio play-by-play broadcaster for the University of Iowa Hawkeyes football and men's basketball teams for Learfield Sports and the Iowa Hawkeye Sports Network. Wikipedia

Charles Osgood.label: Charles Osgood
Charles Osgood.description: Charles Osgood is a radio and television commentator in the United States. His daily program, The Osgood File, has been broadcast on the CBS Radio Network since 1971. Osgood hosts CBS News Sunday Morning. Wikipedia
Charles Osgood.Born: January 8, 1933 (age 81), New York City, New York, United States

Ira Flatow.label: Ira Flatow
Ira Flatow.description: Ira Flatow is a radio and television journalist and author who hosts Public Radio International's popular Science Friday. On TV, he hosted the Emmy Award-winning Newton's Apple, a television science program for children and their families. Wikipedia
Ira Flatow.Born: March 9, 1949 (age 65), New York City, New York, United States
Education: The State University of New York

Warren Ballentine.label: Warren Ballentine
Warren Ballentine.description: Warren Ballentine is an African American motivational speaker, attorney, political activist, and radio talk show host. Wikipedia
Education: North Carolina Agricultural and Technical State University

Charles Adler (broadcaster).label: Charles Adler
Charles Adler (broadcaster).description: Charles Adler is a Hungarian-born Canadian broadcaster. Wikipedia

Sandra Maischberger.label: Sandra Maischberger
Sandra Maischberger.description: Sandra Maischberger is a German journalist, talk show host, and author. She is the sister of German archeologist Martin Maischberger. Wikipedia

Fausto Silva.description: Fausto Silva was born Fausto Corrêa da Silva. He is a Brazilian TV presenter. Wikipedia
Fausto Silva.Born: May 2, 1950 (age 63), Porto Ferreira, São Paulo, Brazil

Luciano Huck.label: Luciano Huck
Luciano Huck.description: Luciano Huck is a Brazilian TV presenter. For the past twelve years, he has hosted “Caldeirão do Huck”, aired every Saturday by Brazilian network Rede Globo. Wikipedia
Luciano Huck.Born: September 3, 1971 (age 42), São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

Sally Obermeder.label: Sally Obermeder
Sally Obermeder.description: Sally Obermeder is an Australian media personality. Wikipedia

Andy Dean.label: America Now with Andy Dean
Andy Dean.description: America Now with Andy Dean is a three-hour syndicated talk radio show hosted by radio talk show host and political commentator Andy Dean, broadcast live 6-9PM EST / 3-6PM PST on weekdays from Premiere Network's Sherman Oaks studios. Wikipedia
